title: Pixel 4's Face Unlock Is Far From Perfect, And Google Knows About It Already
text:
Pixel 4's Face Unlock Is Far From Perfect, And Google Knows About It Already

Pixel 4's Face Unlock Is Far From Perfect, And Google Knows About It Already

Google Pixel 4 (and 4XL) was the most awaited Android smartphone but it gave us one blow after another, completely killing the enthusiasm for the smartphone.

And now, Google has told us that the Face Unlock feature on the Pixel 4 can be easily fooled with your twin or someone who looks like you.

AP

Google revealed this in the support page of Google Pixel 4 where it says, "your phone can be unlocked by someone who looks a lot like you, like an identical sibling." This is really odd, considering Google has a paraphernalia of sensors (which don't help face unlock be more secure) including the much-touted Soli Radar chip -- the reason for which the Pixel 4 won't be making its way to India.

AP

Don't Miss 3.9 K SHARES 181 SHARES

However, the Soli chip has nothing to do with security and authentication. All it does is detects the user with the help of its Radar tech to unlock the phone instantly. When you strech your hands to use the phone, the radar chip will detect that and instantaneously turn the front camera on, unlocking the phone when it's in your hands, without even the need of pressing the power button.

Google

While the phone getting unlocked by twins or look-alikes is a very specific concern, there's another major flaw in the face unlock technology on Pixel 4. Reports have revealed that the face unlock feature gets easily unlocked even when your eyes are closed. So anyone who wants to gain access to your smartphone just needs to show your sleeping face and that's pretty much it.

Google

Considering there is no fingerprint scanner on the phone, your next bet of securing the phone is using the dated pin/password-based method. We don't know if Google will be fixing this issue with future OTA updates or will this be the way it is supposed to be.

Would you still buy a Pixel 4? Let us know in the comments below.
